articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Norway's $1.4 trillion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, posted a loss of 374 billion Norwegian crowns ($33.80 billion) in the third quarter of 2023 as all asset classes fell in value, it said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Norway's wealth fund posts $34 bln loss in Q3

articles.author: Joseph White
articles.description: General Motors (GM.N) on Tuesday withdrew its previous guidance for 2023 profits and near-term electric vehicle production as costs related to the United Auto Workers strikes jumped to $200 million a week during October.
articles.title: GM withdraws 2023 guidance as UAW strike costs soar

articles.author: Stephen Nellis, Max Cherney
articles.description: Nvidia (NVDA.O) dominates the market for artificial intelligence computing chips. Now it is coming after Intel’s longtime stronghold of personal computers.
articles.title: Exclusive: Nvidia to make Arm-based PC chips in major new challenge to Intel

articles.author: David French
articles.description: Exxon Mobil (XOM.N) and Chevron (CVX.N) are flush with cash yet their acquisition targets are taking stock as the only form of payment, an arrangement that allows the two largest U.S. energy companies to clinch transformative deals despite volatile oil and gas prices.
articles.title: Analysis: Cash-rich Exxon, Chevron use stock for mega deals amid energy market jitters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Euro zone business activity took a surprise turn for the worse this month as demand fell in a broad-based downturn across the region, a survey showed, suggesting the bloc may slip into recession.
articles.title: Euro zone PMI hits lowest in nearly 3 years, stirs recession worries

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's Great Wall Motor said it had formally submitted responses to the European Commission's anti-subsidy investigation of Chinese-made electric vehicles (EVs), while calling for a fair and open trade environment.
articles.title: China's Great Wall Motor is first EV maker to respond to EU anti-subsidy probe

articles.author: Dan Levine, Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: Closing arguments are set to begin on Tuesday in the first U.S. trial over allegations that Tesla's (TSLA.O) Autopilot driver assistant feature led to a death, and its results could help shape similar cases across the country.
articles.title: Tesla Autopilot fatality case to soon reach California jury

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel's military said it was preparing for "unrelenting attacks" to dismantle Hamas while former U.S. President Barack Obama warned that "any Israeli military strategy that ignores the human costs could ultimately backfire."
articles.title: Israel promises 'unrelenting attacks' on Hamas; US, Obama urge caution

articles.author: Miranda Murray, Ludwig Burger
articles.description: Several people were hospitalised in Austria after using suspected fake versions of the diabetes drug Ozempic, the country's health safety body said, the first report of harm to users in a widening European hunt for counterfeiters.
articles.title: Suspected fake Ozempic puts several in hospital in Austria

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An off-duty pilot accused of trying to shut off the engines of an Alaska Airlines jet on a weekend flight over the Pacific Northwest was due to make his first court appearance on Tuesday in Portland, Oregon, where he faced 83 counts of attempted murder.
articles.title: Off-duty pilot accused of trying to disable jetliner faces first court hearing
